meanings.sent1: Before the trip, I always precheck my luggage to make sure I have everything I need.
meanings.sent2: She likes to precheck her work for any errors before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to precheck the crime scene to gather clues before anyone else arrived.
meanings.sent4: The teacher prechecks the students' understanding by asking questions before moving on to the next topic.
meanings.sent5: Prechecking the weather forecast helped us plan our outdoor activities accordingly.

meanings.definition: The act of checking in advance
meanings.sent1: His prechecking of the equipment saved us from a lot of trouble during the event.
meanings.sent2: The prechecking of tickets at the entrance ensured a smooth flow of people into the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The prechecking of the documents was necessary to avoid any delays in the process.
meanings.sent4: The prechecking of the safety measures reassured everyone that the event would be secure.
meanings.sent5: The prechecking of the schedule helped us avoid overlapping appointments.

meanings.sent1: The prechecking process made the boarding of the flight much quicker.
meanings.sent2: The prechecking passengers were allowed to proceed directly to the gate.
meanings.sent3: The prechecking system at the airport helped reduce waiting times for travelers.
meanings.sent4: The prechecking staff ensured that all necessary documents were in order before boarding.
meanings.sent5: The prechecking counter was designated for passengers with special needs.
